refnamediv.refpurpose: Read signals from a file at k-rate.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Read signals from a file at k-rate.

refsect1.title: Syntax
refsect1.synopsis: fink ifilename, iskipframes, iformat, kin1 [, kin2] [, kin3] [,...]

refsect1.title: Initialization
refsect1.para: ifilename -- input file name (can be a string or a handle number generated by fiopen)
iskipframes -- number of frames to skip at the start (every frame contains a sample of each channel)

iformat -- a number specifying the input file format. If a header is found, this argument is ignored.
0 - 32 bit floating points without header
1 - 16 bit integers without header

refsect1.title: Performance
refsect1.para: fink is the same as fin but operates at k-rate.

note.para: Please note that since this opcode generates its output using input parameters (on the right side of the opcode), these variables must be initialized before use, otherwise a 'used before defined' error will occur. You can use the init opcode for this.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para:
Here is an example of the fink opcode. It uses the file fink.csd.
Example of the fink opcode.
See the sections Real-time Audio and Command Line Flags for more information on using command line flags.
Note that this example requires the file test.txt to be created, for example by fouti
